Database.controller

Class DatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database.controller.DatabaseController

  • public class DatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatabaseController(DatabaseAppController baseController)
      The database controller, passed through the base controller and calls for the program to check the driver and set-up a connection between the SQL server and the program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseController

        public DatabaseController(DatabaseAppController baseController)
        The database controller, passed through the base controller and calls for the program to check the driver and set-up a connection between the SQL server and the program.
        Parameters:
        baseController - The controller that runs the program.

    • Method Detail

      • connectionStringBuilder

        public void connectionStringBuilder(java.lang.String pathToDBServer,
                           java.lang.String databaseName,
                           java.lang.String userName,
                           java.lang.String password)
        Makes the connection string.
        Parameters:
        pathToDBServer - The path to the Database Server (this will be an IP or Localhost)
        databaseName - The Name of the Database being pulled up.
        userName - The Username for getting into the Database.
        password - The password for getting into the Database.

        Parameters:
        query - The statement passed to SQL.

      • selectQueryResults

        public java.lang.String[][] selectQueryResults(java.lang.String query)
        Generic version of the select query method. Will work with any database specified by the connectionString value.
        Parameters:
        query - The SELECT query to be turned into a ResultSet object.
        Returns:
        The 2D array of results from said query.

      • realResults

        public java.lang.String[][] realResults()
        Gets the results
        Returns:
        The Columns and Rows.

      • setupConnection

        public void setupConnection()
        Set-up the connection with the SQL server, displays an error message if it fails.

      • displayTables

        public java.lang.String displayTables()
        Displays the Table that holds the data from the database.
        Returns:
        The names of the table and the table itself.

      • getMetaDataTitles

        public java.lang.String[] getMetaDataTitles()
        Meta-Data is good for getting the data from the database. It starts with the column count, and then moves to the column name.
        Returns:
        The names of the columns on the table.

      • getDatabaseColumnNames

        public java.lang.String[] getDatabaseColumnNames(java.lang.String tableName)
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table that is pulled up.
        Returns:
        The names of the columns in the Table/Database.

      • testResults

        public java.lang.String[][] testResults()
        Makes a 2D array that returns the results (fields) from the table.
        Returns:
        The results from the table.

      • insertSample

        public int insertSample()
        Inserts a sample query into the database.
        Returns:
        Puts sample data into the database in the given table.

      • displayErrors

        public void displayErrors(java.lang.Exception currentException)
        Gets the errors and displays them. Displays the Exception, the SQL State, and the Error code.
        Parameters:
        currentException - The variable giving the exception/error.
